job_title: Revenue Cycle Manager in Chicago, IL

pros: Autonomy, technology, friends, water-coolers, clean refrigerators.
cons: VP's and up don't realize that despite saying "we're a family" and "we care about your mental health"- what really matters in this economy is financial stability. WORKERS' financial stability. The pay scales here are a joke for an org that has seen its revenue go up each year for the last 4 years. CEO made 411k in 2020.

pros: Great coworkers and organization, friendly atmosphere.

When I first joined The Family Institute I was a student in the Masters of Science Marriage and Family Therapy program, class of 2014. My academic experience was led by some of the most influential researchers and clinicians in the field. I quickly learned that The Family Institute prides themselves on maintaining an inclusive, informative and innovative voice in the field of marriage and family therapy. Upon receiving my doctorate, making the decision to return to such a integrative and collaborative space was a no-brainer. I am incredibly excited to start my post-doctoral career at The Family Institute, ultimately gaining the opportunity to practice exceptional clinical work among outstanding colleagues.
cons: No downsides to report at this time.
Morale is very low. Expectations very high. Administration only cares about quantity and not quality of the work.  High turnover and burnout rate.
